ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 1193
ygData.msgSnippet: LOL well I can agree with the rich part for sure! 10k plat for one of them isn t cheap! I have one for my cleric as well and I found that (other than medding
ygData.messageBody:
LOL well I can agree with the "rich" part for sure! 10k plat for one of
them isn't cheap!

I have one for my cleric as well and I found that (other than medding
and looking rich) they help when you are in an area with a lot of hills
(You don't get injured from falling) and if you are encumbered it helps.
They are fun to ride on but slow to start and slow to stop. It's like
its emulating you spuring it's side and saying "Giddyup!". Oh and they
eat like mad! So either become good a baking or buy cheap food (Or
better yet summon if you can) and keep it in an unbagged slot so it will
be the first food to get eaten.

As for the old debate of which is better, a Drog or a Horse, all I will
say is just keep this in mind, on a horse you constantly have his/her
head in your view and can make targeting a little difficult if you are
just manually clicking on your target. With a Drog you don't have the
head in your view, unless you are surrounded by a bunch of gnomes!

:-) Durgaa

EverQuest@yahoogroups.com wrote:

Message: 2
Date: Thu, 30 Jun 2005 18:39:08 -0000
From: "mushuplus" <mushuplus@...>
Subject: Are slow horses worth getting?

They look fun to ride on, but i don't think they are worth it because
on my friend's account he has a cheap drog and then i found out the
cheap ones are slow =P lol. Are the horses the same? All the things
the cheap ones do is make you look rich.
